title: Man who stole, sacrificed and ATE pet cats jailed after neighbours notice foul odour
text:

A man who stole, sacrificed and ate pet cats has been jailed after neighbours tipped-off police about the foul odour coming from his property. 
David Andres Florez Acosta, 31, confessed to his crimes as soon as he was arrested, a court heard, saying not only had he killed the cats but he had eaten them as well. 
He became the first person in Colombia to be jailed for animal abuse, receiving a six-month sentence at a court in the city of Amaga, in the north-western Colombian department of Antioquia. 
Prosecution lawyers said: "The investigation is linked with the robbery of several cats , among them the one owned by the church of the city. David Andres Florez Acosta stealing a cat from a church (Photo: CEN) David Andres Florez Acosta with the stolen cats and two police officers (Photo: CEN) 
"The cats were sacrificed and eaten in the house of the arrested man." Read More 
Florez Acosta had been arrested in September 2016 at his house, where police found a skull and skins of several cats that matched descriptions of stolen animals. 
Police found him after tip-offs from neighbours who had noticed a foul odour emanating from the property. 
Colombian media reported that eating horse, dog and cat meat is not banned in the country, but that the suspect had been charged with animal cruelty and was the first to be convicted of the newly created crime. Read More A Street Cat Named Bob author reveals inspiration for book-turned-movie 
In January 2016 the president of Colombia Juan Manuel Santos approved the new law against animal abuse in order to make clear that animals are "feeling beings," he said. 
The new law provides for a sentence of up to 36 months in prison for those who abuse wild or domestic animals. Like us on Facebook
